task_summary: Pick up the red object from the table using a robotic manipulator, following an evidence-grounded stepwise plan as depicted in the provided contact sheet frames.

task_long_description.overview: A robot arm is tasked to pick up a red cylindrical object from a table. The scene includes a blue spiked ball and a purple polyhedral object, but only the red object is targeted. The robot uses perception to identify the object, approaches above it, aligns, grasps, and verifies successful pickup before lifting. The plan is defined by framewise evidence and the explicit task instruction that specifies no further placement, constraints on stability, and that the object must be securely in the gripper at the end.
preconditions: Red object is present and visible on the table
Robot arm is initialized and in starting pose
stepwise_plan: Verify visibility or perform scan to localize the red object
Detect precise location of the red object
Open the gripper to suitable width
Move above the red object at an appropriate height
Approach and precisely align gripper to object
Close gripper gently to grasp the object
Verify object is held in gripper
Lift the red object off the table
success_criteria: Red object is securely held in the gripper
Object is lifted clear of the table
No unintended collisions or object drops
failure_and_recovery: Object not detected: retry scan for up to 3 attempts
Grasp unsuccessful: repeat grasp phase or abort
Object slips during lift: reattempt approach and grip
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when the red object is stably held and lifted from the table.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Check if the red object is visible.
Scan the workspace in a grid pattern to find the red object (max 3 attempts).
Run object detection on the red object.
Open gripper to 6cm width prior to picking.
Position gripper 5cm above the red object.
Approach and align gripper to the red object within tight tolerance.
Close gripper gently to grasp red object.
Verify the red object is securely in the gripper.

failure_modes: Red object not detected after retries
Grasp unsuccessful (object not securely in gripper)
recovery_strategy: Retry scan up to 3 times for perception failure
Repeat approach and grip for grasp failure
Abort lift if grip is not verified
assumptions: Instruction requests only picking, not placing or transferring
Frames do not visually confirm object placement; design ends with lift
Red object matches the visible cylinder in all frames

expected_success_criteria: Red object is visible in gripper and lifted off table after final frame
